page.title: 06LIFE STYLE
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF CHOLESBURY: Cholesbury was originally an Iron Age settlement.Most of the houses are clustered round the Common.The 17th century houses have foot-scrapers.There is a moated encampment covering about 10 acres next to the medieval church.The boundary between Cholesbury and Hawridge is marked by an ancient stone erected in 1828. Most people before they came to Cholesbury lived in the suburbs of London;some came out of London during the war to avoid the bombing.Two of the inhabitants were moved out during the war and decided to stay when the war was over and had a house built for them on an acre of land. Most of the farms have many animals and an orchard.The village hall was built in 1885 and is for public use.
